I have a feeling you're probably retaliating, not defending yourself. Defense of YOUR self would only involve talking about yourself. If you insult someone in reaction to someone insulting you, thats retaliation, not self defense. Self defense would be like when someone calls you trash, you say "no im not". Retaliation to someone calling you trash would be like "shut up noob" lol. You never have a need to talk about someone else when defending yourself. It involves defense of YOU, not offense of another.

Also, in the real world, where self defense involves actual physical altercations, self defense would be eliminating the threat. I think applying that to chat, eliminating the threat would be muting.

What I am referring to in my discussion is how a whole team turns on you cause of the champ you pick. And because of my pick, not 1, not 2 but the whole team flames you. This flame comes in the form of conversation and game-play (ie letting enemy 2v1, 3v1 you because they don't like your champion and THEN flame you) You guys are making it seem like in a TEAM game I am suppose mute the team.

This flame comes in the form of conversation and game-play (ie letting enemy 2v1, 3v1 you because they don't like your champion and THEN flame you) You guys are making it seem like in a TEAM game I am suppose mute the team.

Muting should only come in to play if you feel their chat is ruining your experience, or you feel like you wont be able to control yourself and not retaliate, as retaliating puts you in punishment territory just like them. I never mute, because I know I'm bad, so flame doesnt really offend me, its just truth and I laugh that they think that I'd feel bad for being bad at a virtual online video game. If youre offended, then yes, why wouldnt you mute? Theyre obviously not saying anything that improves your experience right?

So yeah, muting isnt for everyone, but its certainly a helpful tool for some. I'm sure it has saved players from getting their own accounts punished. Its a safe alternative to retaliation. The old saying is "mute, report, move on" but I usually just stick to the second two; report, move on. 

(I actually do use mute when someone is being extra bitchy in chat complaining about everything as they lose lane, fuck those people, theyre annoying af)
